title: Local Entrepreneurs Marketplace with 6 Business Categories

requirements.text: Create the core marketplace data model and APIs to support local entrepreneurs listing products and being discovered by customers, including: (a) business categories (approximately 6 categories), (b) entrepreneur/seller profiles, (c) product listings tied to sellers and categories, and (d) public browsing/search endpoints.

quotes: I need an app thath help local entrepreneurs be recognized and sell their product on my app this app has to have all almost 6 categories of these businesses

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query/update methods to: list categories, list products (with optional category filter), get product details, list sellers, and get seller profile.
Backend supports authenticated updates for sellers to create/update/delete their own seller profile and product listings.
Data persists across canister upgrades using stable storage patterns (no external database).
Categories are initialized with ~6 entries and can be returned via a categories list API.

requirements.text: Implement authentication with Internet Identity for entrepreneurs so they can manage their seller profile and product listings; allow unauthenticated users to browse categories, sellers, and products.

quotes: help local entrepreneurs be recognized and sell their product

acceptanceCriteria: Entrepreneur actions (create/update seller profile, create/update/delete products) require a signed-in identity.
Browsing (view categories, browse products, view seller profile) works without signing in.
UI clearly indicates signed-in state and provides sign in/sign out controls.

requirements.text: Build the customer-facing browsing experience: a home page that highlights the marketplace purpose, a category navigation for approximately 6 categories, product browsing with category filtering, product detail view, and seller profile view showing seller info and their products.

quotes: help local entrepreneurs be recognized and sell their product

acceptanceCriteria: Users can browse a list/grid of categories and select one to filter products.
Users can view a product details page with key information (name, price if provided, description, seller).
Users can navigate to a seller profile page and see that seller’s product list.
All user-facing UI text is in English.

requirements.text: Build an entrepreneur dashboard for creating and managing their presence on the app: create/edit seller profile (e.g., business name, description, category, contact info) and create/edit/delete product listings (e.g., title, description, category, price, optional image URL).

quotes: help local entrepreneurs be recognized and sell their product on my app

acceptanceCriteria: Signed-in entrepreneurs can create or edit a seller profile.
Signed-in entrepreneurs can add a new product, edit an existing product, and delete a product they own.
Dashboard reflects backend state (shows the entrepreneur’s current products and profile fields).

requirements.text: Add a simple “interest/order request” flow that lets a customer submit a purchase interest message for a product (stored as an inquiry linked to product + seller), so the app supports “sell their product” without requiring external payment integrations.

quotes: sell their product on my app

acceptanceCriteria: From a product detail page, a user can submit an inquiry (name/contact + message).
Backend stores inquiries per product/seller and sellers can list inquiries for their products in the dashboard.
Sellers can mark an inquiry as handled/resolved.

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive visual theme and layout for an initial v1 marketplace, with a distinct style (not blue/purple): define color palette, typography, spacing, and component usage and apply consistently across pages (home, category browse, product detail, seller profile, dashboard).
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a consistent theme (colors/typography) across all main screens.
Theme avoids a blue/purple primary look; choose an alternative suitable for a local marketplace (e.g., warm neutrals/earth tones).
Pages are responsive and usable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Generate and include static brand assets for the app (logo + hero illustration) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve via backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Home page includes the hero illustration and app logo in a way that fits the chosen theme.
Assets load correctly in production build (no broken image links).

constraints: Use Motoko in a single backend actor (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed by the system context; compose these components instead.
No external databases or third-party auth providers; use Internet Identity only.
nonGoals: Integrated payments/checkout processing (e.g., Stripe) is out of scope for this v1.
Shipping/tax calculation and order fulfillment workflows are out of scope.
Social media API integrations are out of scope.

required: Marketplace app logo, simple modern mark with warm earth-tone palette (logo.dim_512x512.png)
Hero illustration showing a friendly local market scene with small business stalls/products in a clean vector style (hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a marketplace app that helps local entrepreneurs get recognized and sell products, organized into ~6 business categories.
preferencesToAdd: User-facing text should be in English.
